constituent: pierce, mama, mother, breasts, oyster, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
heisigStory: If one is asked to think of associations for the word pierce, among the first to come to mind is that of piercing one's ears to hold earrings, a quite primitive form of self-mutilation that has survived into the 21st century. The kanji here is read, top to bottom: mama . . . oyster. All you need to do is imagine piercing an ear so that it can hold a mother-of-pearl (actually, a mama-of-pearl) you have just wrested from an oyster.
koohiiStory1: Ariel the Little Mermaid´s clamshell bra was held to her breasts by piercings.
koohiiStory2: The sad fate of Mama shellfish was to be captured and pierced to make an earring.
words:
貫禄(かんろく): presence, dignity
貫く(つらぬく): to go through
